content.full_text:
Abraham Lincoln to William Brown, 22 October 18461 I have just returned fromColes, where I sawFicklin, who handed me a note onAnthony Thorntonand somebody else, with $25– in money, which he directed me to pass over to you,

upon presentation of his receipt (for the note I suppose)– I want to get the matter off of my hands– What shall be done about it?
paragraphs: Abraham Lincoln to William Brown, 22 October 18461 I have just returned fromColes, where I sawFicklin, who handed me a note onAnthony Thorntonand somebody else, with $25– in money, which he directed me to pass over to you,
upon presentation of his receipt (for the note I suppose)– I want to get the matter off of my hands– What shall be done about it?

footnotes.text: 1Abraham  Lincoln wrote and signed the letter.

structured_content.text: Abraham Lincoln to William Brown, 22 October 18461

I have just returned fromColes, where I sawFicklin, who handed me a note onAnthony Thorntonand somebody else, with $25– in money, which he directed me to pass over to you,
               upon presentation of his receipt (for the note I suppose)–
I want to get the matter off of my hands–  What shall be done about it?
